alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Rusk; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 12:36PM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Cherokee, Nacogdoches, Panola, Rusk and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Henderson, Kilgore, Tatum, New London, Beckville, Minden, Pinehill, Joinerville, New Salem, Trawick, Cushing, Mount Enterprise, Reklaw, Chapman, Church Hill, Brachfield, Laneville, Dotson, Fairplay and Lawsonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
